Methods¶

Data.__init__(name=None, data_X=None, data_Y=None, dtype=None, pars_central=None, pars_pos_poi=None, pars_pos_nuis=None, pars_labels=None, pars_bounds=None, test_fraction=None, load_on_RAM=False, output_folder=None, input_file=None, verbose=True)[source]¶

The Data object can be initialized in two different ways, depending on the value of the input_file argument.

  • input_file is None (default)

    All other arguments are parsed and saved in corresponding attributes. If no name is given, then one is created. The object is saved upon creation through the Data.save method.

  • input_file is not None

    The object is reconstructed from the input files through the private method Data.__load. If the load_on_RAM argument is True, then all samples are loaded into RAM, otherwise the dataset is kept open and data are retrieved on demand. Depending on the value of the input argument output_folder the Histfactory.__init__ method behaves as follows:

    • If output_folder is None (default)

      The attribute Histfactory.output_folder is set from the Histfactory.input_folder one.

    • If output_folder corresponds to a path different from that stored in the loaded Histfactory.output_folder attribute

      • if path stored in the loaded Histfactory.output_folder attribute exists, then its content is copied to the new output_folder (if the new output_foler already exists it is renamed by adding a timestamp);

      • if path stored in the loaded Histfactory.output_folder does not exists, then the content of the path Histfactory.input_folder is copied to the new output_folder.

    • If output_folder corresponds to the same path stored in the loaded Histfactory.output_folder attribute

      Output folder, files, and path attributes are not updated and everything is read from the loaded object.

  • Arguments

    See class Arguments documentation.

  • Creates files

    • Data.output_log_file

    • Data.output_object_h5_file (only the first time the object is created, i.e. if input_file is None)

    • Data.output_samples_h5_file (only the first time the object is created, i.e. if input_file is None)

Data._Data__check_define_input_files()¶

Private method used by the Data.__init__ one to set the attributes corresponding to input files:

  • Data.input_log_file

  • Data.input_object_h5_file

  • Data.input_samples_h5_file

depending on the value of the Data.input_file attribute.

Data._Data__check_define_output_files()¶

Private method used by the Data.__init__ one to set the attributes corresponding to output folders

  • DnnLik.output_figures_folder

  • DnnLik.output_folder

and output files

  • DnnLik.output_figures_base_file

  • Data.output_log_file

  • Data.output_object_h5_file

  • Data.output_samples_h5_file

depending on the values of the Data.output_folder attribute. It also creates the folder Data.output_folder if it does not exist.

Data._Data__check_define_name()¶

Private method used by the Data.__init__ one to define the Data.name attribute. If it is None it replaces it with "model_"+datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M-%S.%fZ")[:-3]+"_data", otherwise it appends the suffix “_data” (preventing duplication if it is already present).

Data._Data__check_define_data()¶

Private method used by the Data.__init__ one to check that data_X and data_Y have the same length, to set the data type attributes Data.dtype_required and Data.dtype_stored (defaults “float64”), and to convert Data.data_X and Data.data_Y into the dtype corresponding to Data.dtype_stored.

Data._Data__check_define_pars(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the Data.__init__ one to check the consistency of the attributes

  • Data.pars_pos_nuis

  • Data.pars_pos_poi

  • Data.pars_central

  • Data.pars_labels

  • Data.pars_bounds

and to convert the attributes

  • Data.pars_pos_nuis

  • Data.pars_pos_poi

  • Data.pars_central

  • Data.pars_bounds

to numpy arrays. If no parameters positions are specified, all parameters are assumed to be parameters of interest. If only the position of the parameters of interest or of the nuisance parameters is specified, the other is automatically generated by matching dimensions. If labels are not provided then Data.pars_labels is set to the value of Data.pars_labels_auto. If parameters bounds are not provided, they are set to (-np.inf,np.inf). A check is performed on the length of the four attributes and an Exception is raised if the length does not match Data.ndims.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

Data._Data__check_sync_data_dictionary(verbose=None)¶

Private method used to check that indices and data are synced in the Data.data_dictionary dictionary. It is called by all methods generating or updating data. This is needed when the Data object is used by the DnnLik one. In particular, when the latter is imported from files only indices are loaded and properly put in the corresponding Data.data_dictionary, while, to gain speed, data are not. Whenever the DnnLik needs data, and calls any of its method that generate them, the method Data.__check_sync_data_dictionary automatically loads the data corresponding to the existing indices in the Data.data_dictionary of the corresponding Data object. See the documentation of the DNNLikelihood object for more details.

Data._Data__load(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the Data.__init__ one to load a previously saved Data object from the files

  • Data.input_samples_h5_file

  • Data.input_object_h5_file

  • Data.input_log_file

If Data.load_on_RAM is True, then all samples are loaded into RAM, otherwise the dataset is kept open and data are retrieved on demand.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

Data._Data__define_test_fraction()¶

Private method used by the Data.__init__ one to set the Data.test_fraction attribute and, from this, the two attributes Data.train_range and Data.test_range containing the range of indices of the train (and validation) and test sets given by Data.data_X and Data.data_Y.

Data.define_test_fraction(verbose=None)[source]¶

Method analog to the private method Data.__define_test_fraction useful to change the available fraction of train/valifation vs test data. Differently from the analog private method, this one updates the files corresponding to the Data.output_object_h5_file and Data.output_log_file attributes.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Updates files

    • Data.output_log_file

    • Data.output_object_h5_file

Data.close_opened_dataset(verbose=None)[source]¶

Closes the opened h5py datasets Data.opened_dataset.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

Data.save_log(overwrite=False, verbose=None)[source]¶

Saves the content of the Data.log attribute in the file Data.output_log_file

This method is called by the methods

  • Data.__init__ with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub if Data.input_file is not None, and with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub otherwise

  • Data.save with overwrite=overwrite and verbose=verbose

  • Data.generate_train_indices with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub

  • Data.generate_train_data with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub

  • Data.update_train_indices with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub

  • Data.update_train_data with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub

  • Data.generate_test_indices with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub

  • Data.generate_test_data with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub

  • Data.compute_sample_weights with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub

  • Data.define_scalers with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub

This method is called by the Data.save method to save the entire object.

  • Arguments

    • overwrite

      If True if a file with the same name already exists, then it gets overwritten. If False is a file with the same name already exists, then the old file gets renamed with the utils.check_rename_file function.

      • type: bool

      • default: False

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Creates/updates file

    • Data.output_log_file

Data.save_object_h5(overwrite=False, verbose=True)[source]¶

The Lik object is saved to the HDF5 file Data.output_object_h5_file, the datasets corresponding to the Data.data_X and Data.data_Y attributes are saved to the file Data.output_samples_h5_file, and the object log is saved to the json file Lik.output_log_file.

This method saves the content of the :attr:Lik.__dict__ <DNNLikelihood.Lik.__dict__> attribute in the h5 file Data.output_object_h5_file using the deepdish package. The following attributes are excluded from the saved dictionary:

  • Data.data_dictionary

  • Data.data_X (saved to the file Data.output_samples_h5_file)

  • Data.data_Y (saved to the file Data.output_samples_h5_file)

  • Data.dtype_required

  • Data.input_file

  • Data.input_samples_h5_file

  • Data.input_object_h5_file

  • Data.input_log_file

  • Data.load_on_RAM

  • Data.log (saved to the file Data.output_log_file)

  • Data.opened_dataset

  • Data.test_range

  • Data.train_range

  • Data.verbose

This method is called by the Data.save method to save the entire object.

  • Arguments

    • overwrite

      If True if a file with the same name already exists, then it gets overwritten. If False is a file with the same name already exists, then the old file gets renamed with the utils.check_rename_file function.

      • type: bool

      • default: False

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Produces file

    • Data.output_object_h5_file

Data.save_samples_h5(overwrite=False, verbose=None)[source]¶

The Lik object is saved to the HDF5 file Data.output_object_h5_file, the datasets corresponding to the Data.data_X and Data.data_Y attributes are saved to the file Data.output_samples_h5_file, and the object log is saved to the json file Lik.output_log_file.

This method saves the content of the attributes Data.data_X and Data.data_Y, and an additional entry with the shape of the former in the h5 file Data.output_samples_h5_file using the h5py package.

This method is called by the Data.save method to save the entire object.

  • Arguments

    • overwrite

      If True if a file with the same name already exists, then it gets overwritten. If False is a file with the same name already exists, then the old file gets renamed with the utils.check_rename_file function.

      • type: bool

      • default: False

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Produces file

    • Data.output_samples_h5_file

Data.save(overwrite=False, verbose=None)[source]¶

The Lik object is saved to the HDF5 file Data.output_object_h5_file, the datasets corresponding to the Data.data_X and Data.data_Y attributes are saved to the file Data.output_samples_h5_file, and the object log is saved to the json file Lik.output_log_file.

This method calls in order the three methods

  • Data.save_log

  • Data.save_object_h5

  • Data.save_samples_h5

to save the full object.

  • Arguments

    Same arguments as the called methods.

  • Produces files

    • Data.output_log_file

    • Data.output_object_h5_file

    • Data.output_samples_h5_file

Data.generate_train_indices(npoints_train, npoints_val, seed, verbose=None)[source]¶

Method used to generate npoints_train train and npoints_val validation data indices (integer positions in the Data.data_X and Data.data_Y arrays). It updates the "idx_train" and "idx_val" items of the Data.data_dictionary dictionary.

  • Arguments

    • npoints_train

      Required number of training points.

      • type: int

    • npoints_val

      Required number of validation points.

      • type: int

    • seed

      Seed of the random number generator. It is used to initialize the numpy random state.

      • type: int

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

Data.generate_train_data(npoints_train, npoints_val, seed, verbose=None)[source]¶

Method used to generate npoints_train train and npoints_val validation data. In order to extract the required number of points from the Data.data_X and Data.data_Y arrays (which may not be available on RAM), it first generates indices with the Data.generate_train_indices method and then slices the data with the generated indices. It updates the "X_train", "Y_train", "X_val" and "Y_val" items of the Data.data_dictionary dictionary.

  • Arguments

    • npoints_train

      Required number of training points.

      • type: int

    • npoints_val

      Required number of validation points.

      • type: int

    • seed

      Seed of the random number generator. It is used to initialize the numpy random state.

      • type: int

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

Data.update_train_indices(npoints_train, npoints_val, seed, verbose=None)[source]¶

Analog of Data.generate_train_indices, but it only updates indices adding more points if any are already available in the Data.data_dictionary dictionary. It updates the "idx_train" and "idx_val" items of the Data.data_dictionary dictionary.

  • Arguments

    • npoints_train

      Required number of training points.

      • type: int

    • npoints_val

      Required number of validation points.

      • type: int

    • seed

      Seed of the random number generator. It is used to initialize the numpy random state.

      • type: int

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

Data.update_train_data(npoints_train, npoints_val, seed, verbose=None)[source]¶

Analog of Data.generate_train_indices, but it only updates data adding more points if any are already available in the Data.data_dictionary dictionary. It updates the "X_train", "Y_train", "X_val" and "Y_val" items of the Data.data_dictionary dictionary.

  • Arguments

    • npoints_train

      Required number of training points.

      • type: int

    • npoints_val

      Required number of validation points.

      • type: int

    • seed

      Seed of the random number generator. It is used to initialize the numpy random state.

      • type: int

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

Data.generate_test_indices(npoints_test, verbose=None)[source]¶

Method used to generate npoints_test test data indices (integer positions in the Data.data_X and Data.data_Y arrays). Test indices are always generated deterministically and always represent the first npoints_test in the Dara.test_range range. It updates the "idx_test" item of the Data.data_dictionary dictionary.

  • Arguments

    • npoints_test

      Required number of test points.

      • type: int

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

Data.generate_test_data(npoints_test, verbose=None)[source]¶

Method used to generate npoints_test test data indices (integer positions in the Data.data_X and Data.data_Y arrays). In order to extract the required number of points from the Data.data_X and Data.data_Y arrays (which may not be available on RAM), it first generates indices with the Data.generate_test_indices method and then slices the data with the generated indices. Test data are always generated deterministically and always correspond to the first npoints_test in the Dara.test_range range of Data.data_X and Data.data_Y. It updates the "X_test" and "Y_test" items of the Data.data_dictionary dictionary.

  • Arguments

    • npoints_test

      Required number of test points.

      • type: int

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

Data.compute_sample_weights(sample, nbins=100, power=1, verbose=None)[source]¶

Method that computes weights of points given their distribution. Sample weights are used to weigth data as a function of their frequency, obtained by binning the data in nbins and assigning weight equal to the inverse of the bin count to the power power. In order to avoid too large weights for bins with very few counts, all bins with less than 5 counts are assigned frequency equal to 1/5 to the power power.

  • Arguments

    • sample

      Distribution of points that need to be weighted.

      • type: numpy.ndarray

      • shape: (len(sample),)

    • nbins

      Number of bins to histogram the sample data

      • type: int

      • default: 100

    • power

      Exponent of the inverse of the bin count used to assign weights.

      • type: float

      • default: 1

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Returns

    Numpy array of the same length of sample containing the required weights.

    • type: numpy.ndarray

    • shape: (len(sample),)

Data.define_scalers(data_X, data_Y, scalerX_bool, scalerY_bool, verbose=None)[source]¶

Method that defines StandardScalers fit to the data_X and data_Y data. Scalers are defined based in the boolean flags scalerX_bool and scalerY_bool. When the flags are false the scalers are defined with the arguemtns with_mean=False and with_std=False which correspond to identity transformations.

  • Arguments

    • data_X

      X data to fit the StandardScaler scalerX.

      • type: numpy.ndarray

      • shape: (npoints,ndim)

    • data_Y

      Y data to fit the StandardScaler scalerY.

      • type: numpy.ndarray

      • shape: (npoints,)

    • scalerX_bool

      If true the X scaler is fit to the data_X data, otherwise it is set to the identity transformation.

      • type: bool

    • scalerY_bool

      If true the Y scaler is fit to the data_Y data, otherwise it is set to the identity transformation.

      • type: bool

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Returns

    List of the form [scalerX,scalerY] containing the X and Y scalers.

    • type: list

    • shape: [scalerX,scalerY]

Data.plot_corners_1samp(X, intervals=array([0.68268949, 0.95449974, 0.9973002]), weights=None, pars=None, max_points=None, nbins=50, pars_labels='original', ranges_extend=None, title='', color='green', plot_title='Corner plot', legend_labels=None, figure_file=None, show_plot=False, overwrite=False, verbose=None)[source]¶

Plots the 1D and 2D distributions (corner plot) of the distribution of the parameters pars in the X array.

  • Arguments

    • X

      List or Numpy array with the values of parameters

      • type: numpy.ndarray

      • shape: (npoints,ndims)

    • intervals

      Probability intervals for which contours are drawn.

      • type: list or numpy.ndarray

      • shape: (nintervals,)

      • default: numpy.array([0.68268949, 0.95449974, 0.9973002]) (corresponding to 1,2, and 3 sigmas for a 1D Gaussian distribution)

    • weights

      List or Numpy array with the Weights correspomnding to the X points

      • type: list or numpy.ndarray or None

      • shape: (npoints,)

      • default: None

    • pars

      List of parameters for which the plots are produced.

      • type: list or None

      • shape of list: [ ]

      • default: None

    • max_points

      Maximum number of points used to make the plot. If the numnber is smaller than the total number of available points, then a random subset is taken. If None then all available points are used.

      • type: int or None

      • default: None

    • nbins

      Number of bins used to make the histograms.

      • type: int

      • default: 50

    • pars_labels

      Argument that is passed to the Data.__set_pars_labels method to set the parameters labels to be used in the plots.

      • type: list or str

      • shape of list: []

      • accepted strings: "original", "generic"

      • default: original

    • ranges_extend

      Percent increase or reduction of the range of the plots with respect to the range automatically determined from the points values.

      • type: int or float or None

    • title

      Subplot title to which the 68% HPDI values are appended.

      • type: str or None

      • default: None

    • color

      Plot color.

      • type: str

      • default: "green"

    • plot title

      Title of the corner plot.

      • type: str

      • default: "Corner plot"

    • legend labels

      List of strings. Labels for the contours corresponding to the intervals to show in the legend. If None the legend automatically reports the intervals.

      • type: str or None

      • default: None

    • figure_file

      File name for the saved figure. If None file name is automatically generated.

      • type: str or None

      • default: None

    • show_plot

      If True the plot is shown on the interactive console.

      • type: bool

      • default: False

    • overwrite

      If True if a file with the same name already exists, then it gets overwritten. If False is a file with the same name already exists, then the old file gets renamed with the utils.check_rename_file function.

      • type: bool

      • default: False

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior. The plots are shown in the interactive console calling plt.show() only if verbose=True.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Updates file

    • Data.output_log_file

Data.set_verbosity()¶

Method inherited from the Verbosity object. See the documentation of Verbosity.set_verbosity.
